results.content: It seems it lacks content between section 4 and section 5 : indeed, we jump from a "business website" without woocommerce plugin in section 4 to a "divishop" site with woocommerce plugin in section 5. I thought the woocommerce plugin would have been also studied like the Divi theme.

results.content: This has been an enjoyable course.  Patrick is very thorough and takes you through every area of the Divi theme to understand how to use it.  I am loving this Theme and plan on purchasing it when I am able.  Thanks again for putting together a great course.
results.content_html: This has been an enjoyable course. Patrick is very thorough and takes you through every area of the Divi theme to understand how to use it. I am loving this Theme and plan on purchasing it when I am able. Thanks again for putting together a great course.

results.content:
I have been thinking about using the Divi theme and to be honest, I thought this would be a cheap way of tasting it. I was initially happily surprised at the quality of the teaching, Patrick is enthusiastic about what he is teaching and I found that infectious.

But it was around half way thru the fontpage tutorials I lost it, it felt like Patrick was repeating himself over and over... and I wasn't learning anything new. So I just watched the remaining vids instead of working alongside them.

I think the course is unfinished, because after the last vid I was expecting another and there was no more. I have dropped only half a star because I think this is still a value-for-money course because:
1> You get the Divi theme thrown in.
2> Patrick is attentive to questions
3> He is adding content to the course
What more can you ask for?
results.content_html:

results.content: The theme was in a file called Divi.zip, not Divi2.zip, and it was too big to load, so had to ftp the unzipped folder.
results.content_html: The theme was in a file called Divi.zip, not Divi2.zip, and it was too big to load, so had to ftp the unzipped folder.

results.content:
I found the structure of the course frustrating, because it didn't seem to be edited for clarity. I was following along making my own website, and when we would have to undo a bunch of work because the instructor decided to try it differently, it ended up feeling like a lot of time was wasted.

I also think that, with the new version of Divi and the visual builder, the course is outdated. I should have done my own due diligence and checked which version of Divi was being offered and which was most current, but - lesson learned!

(I don't mean this to be harsh - the instructor has a great sense of humour and is pretty engaging - but halfway through the course I gave up because I felt like I was spending so much time doing and then undoing work. I would much rather have learned it and done it the first time, rather than going back again and again.)
results.content_html:
